title: Pisses me off when our autofilled ADC mains support, and our autofilled support mains ADC.
body:
Of all the ways to lose a game, this has to be one of the most shitty ways.

You look up the players on your team, but it's too late to say anything because either the adc or the support already made their pick. If you had seen it sooner, or if they had looked themselves up, it might have been easy to get them to swap roles with each other.

Can Riot please look into this? Give the matchmaker one single brain cell? You would be surprised how often this happens. This is such a depressing way to lose a game. I mean, I don't mind losing, but I hate it when I have a loss that seems to be entirely due to a poorly coded matchmaker.

By the way, the entire enemey team had no autofills. Our team also had no autofills, except that our ADC was on support, and our support was our ADC. Our bot lane played poorly and lost their lane, and that was the entire reason we lost the game. And to think that we had a good ADC, and we had a good support! But they weren't on their damn roles! We had all we needed to win that game! If only the match maker had a brain.

replies.body: Auto Fill is extraordinarily ridiculously flawed. This isn't an isolated incident. There are cases in which 4 people on the same team will end up filled. I've personally experienced being filled when an ally of mine specifically opted to fill and the game filled them in the role I wanted.

Months back, I paired with a friend. We were both autofilled into each others roles.

We laughed about it and just switched. But still its ridiculous.

I can do you better then that
I duo with a friend of mine, I top/mid and he jungle/mids
We have had games where I am autofilled to jungle and he is autofilled to sup or somthing.......you know...rather then just autofill me and he gets his role
Hell, we have even had a game or two where I have been autofilled jungle and he was autofilled top.....
The autofill system is r%%%%%ed, I honestly believe it autofills you sometimes not because there isn't the space on the team but becuase the algorithm just says it's your time to be autofilled

the real question is 

how the hell did your support manage to get autofilled?

> [{quoted}](name=FOR JUSTICE,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MLLzgAuv,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2019-06-30T16:51:18.778+0000)
>
> the real question is 
> 
> how the hell did your support manage to get autofilled?

Right?
that would be because support is no longer the least picked role. I believe it is now jg.

^
Im a jungle main and sometimes I just wanna go off role for a bit but still get jungle anyways. It pisses me off because sometimes I just need a break. D:
The algorithm is designed to fill for support it doesn't know how to handle it when the fill is jungle so the system just freaks out and fills everywhere.

Welcome to the on-and-off clusterfuck situation that is Jungle, and the permanent clusterfuck situation that is Toplane. Riot has completely destroyed the fun of the former, and has never even touched the latter.

why wouldnt they just swap roles?

honestly, the easiest and laziest solution for riot would be to put a tiny symbol onto the bottom right corner of your champ select box that indicates the main (and maybe even secondary) role you qued up with.

could save a lot of pain. especially in those cases. they could immediately identify that they just need to swap roles.
been saying this since team builder days.  People should have their main role as an icon next to their name.

> [{quoted}](name=Critmaster Garen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MLLzgAuv,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-06-30T15:31:23.337+0000)
>
> why wouldnt they just swap roles?
> 
> honestly, the easiest and laziest solution for riot would be to put a tiny symbol onto the bottom right corner of your champ select box that indicates the main (and maybe even secondary) role you qued up with.
> 
> could save a lot of pain. especially in those cases. they could immediately identify that they just need to swap roles.

This is my gripe about this game in totality. There is so much information that (admittedly can be volunteered by players simply speaking up) can be communicated with little symbols and such. I mean, if we have an autofill support who isn't comfortable with the role, why wouldn't the team want to know that and play around it? 

For as much as Riot wants to introduce mechanics that reduce toxicity, it seems to be omitting or passing over mechanics that would truly do this.

The thing is how the hell do OP notices that both are autofilled and they are just not queuing not for their main roles which sometimes happen because they are burned out of playing always the same

Because if any of them says on the chat that "hey I'm an ADC main autofilled to Supp" and the Supp is autofilled to ADC they would most likely trade their roles and he wouldn't create this thread right ?

OP doesn't know a shit and he just assumes that they are autofilled because he wants to bitch about anything instead of improving his skill

> [{quoted}](name=Sir Saltarin,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MLLzgAuv,comment-id=00050004,timestamp=2019-07-01T00:26:35.250+0000)
>
> The thing is how the hell do OP notices that both are autofilled and they are just not queuing not for their main roles which sometimes happen because they are burned out of playing always the same
> 
> Because if any of them says on the chat that "hey I'm an ADC main autofilled to Supp" and the Supp is autofilled to ADC they would most likely trade their roles and he wouldn't create this thread right ?
> 
> OP doesn't know a shit and he just assumes that they are autofilled because he wants to bitch about anything instead of improving his skill

He may have the Blitz app, which shows what one person's main role is, but it doesn't show what they qued for. Maybe he asked later when they started sucking.

> honestly, the easiest and laziest solution for riot would be to put a tiny symbol onto the bottom right corner of your champ select box that indicates the main (and maybe even secondary) role you qued up with.
> 
> could save a lot of pain. especially in those cases. they could immediately identify that they just need to swap roles.

Completely agree. It's ridiculous that RIOT is so blind to such simple things. You would think one person, among thousands, would be like "hey, maybe this is a good idea...." for something that would literally take an hour to do.

> why wouldnt they just swap roles?

OP said "You look up the players on your team, but it's too late to say anything because either the adc or the support already made their pick. If you had seen it sooner, or if they had looked themselves up, it might have been easy to get them to swap roles with each other." which is completely reasonable. You won't always catch things like that.
Yeah I've been wanting them to add an indicator for what players chose ever since  normal draft came out.
Then it would create a confusion of players who play all roles or few roles about equal.
you're smart. {{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}
And someone still believes that their matchmaking works fine, when they even can't code a simple stuff like "don't swap 2 guys roles" :D

That's not at all how that would be done, it would likely require several very specific paragraphs of code that would then have to be checked against thousands if not millions of other paragraphs of code.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MLLzgAuv,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2019-06-30T23:46:44.564+0000)
>
> That's not at all how that would be done, it would likely require several very specific paragraphs of code that would then have to be checked against thousands if not millions of other paragraphs of code.

"paragraphs of code"

When, in the course of human events, a variable is declared as an integer but assigned no initial value...

Assuming it is connected directly to the champ select, you would need one paragraph of code for every single player in the match, there's 10.

They would each need a paragraph for each role per player + 2 more for each selected.
Okay, so now we're at... 80.

We would then need to compare each player to the other players, resulting in an additional 45 lines, or around 9 paragraphs.  Kay so now we have the teams and can determine the requested feature.  How would we do that?
89

It wouldn't be "don't swap two guys' roles".

It would, arbitrarily require a paragraph between each person on the team, or 10 more paragraphs.
99

Assuming by some miracle there are no conflicts we have 99, almost _one hundred paragraphs_.

And quite frankly the idea of there being no conflicts when adding 100 new paragraphs would make any programmer laugh.
To give a rough and again arbitrary estimation.  Add another, idk 30'graphs to cover conflicts, + who knows how many lines must be added to parts of the program linked to this new feature.

You're probably talking at least 200 paragraphs of code.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MLLzgAuv,comment-id=000a000000000000,timestamp=2019-07-01T00:28:11.851+0000)
>
> Assuming it is connected directly to the champ select, you would need one paragraph of code for every single player in the match, there's 10.
> 
> They would each need a paragraph for each role per player + 2 more for each selected.
> Okay, so now we're at... 80.
> 
> We would then need to compare each player to the other players, resulting in an additional 45 lines, or around 9 paragraphs.  Kay so now we have the teams and can determine the requested feature.  How would we do that?
> 89
> 
> It wouldn't be "don't swap two guys' roles".
> 
> It would, arbitrarily require a paragraph between each person on the team, or 10 more paragraphs.
> 99
> 
> Assuming by some miracle there are no conflicts we have 99, almost _one hundred paragraphs_.
> 
> And quite frankly the idea of there being no conflicts when adding 100 new paragraphs would make any programmer laugh.
> To give a rough and again arbitrary estimation.  Add another, idk 30'graphs to cover conflicts, + who knows how many lines must be added to parts of the program linked to this new feature.
> 
> You're probably talking at least 200 paragraphs of code.

My point is that you keep saying "paragraph(s) of code" when code does not come in "paragraphs."

On top of that, your assumptions of how much code would be necessary to do this are also not only wild guesses, but poorly-formulated ones. For example, "you would need one paragraph of code for every single player in the match, there's 10." As I always ask my students when they try to implement an algorithm like this, "what if there aren't just three, but ten? A hundred? A million?" You need more code to handle _different_ input, not _more of the same_ input.

N.B.: I'm assuming you're being sincere rather than messing with me, the latter of which is honestly not a difficult thing for most people to do. :(

Being able to copy paste the code doesn't lower the number.

And people are far more likely to grasp "paragraph" than "block".

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MLLzgAuv,comment-id=000a00000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-07-01T01:15:16.693+0000)
>
> Being able to copy paste the code doesn't lower the number.
> 
> And people are far more likely to grasp "paragraph" than "block".

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copy-and-paste_programming

I think you havent heard of any loops lol

"one paragraph of code"  do you know what the parent and child categories are for code?  You can make one parent category that has as many options as you have memory available or otherwise the limits of the computer (I don't remember the specific number values for some of them as they had to do with Binary Code limitations

More likely it would take like 4-10 lines of code in the form of either an if/then, or a switch statement as either a final argument or at the top of the autofiller. And you certainly wouldn't need to check it against the (highly likely) millions of lines of code in this game manually. That's why compilers and debuggers exist.

Given even the worst code structure, it's not the kind of thing that would take one person more than a day.

I'm a support main and I don't think I've ever got auto-filled. Like honestly, ever. So, I might be wrong, but it's also possible that the support main purposely qued as adc cause he got bored of his role? 

Also, I see many people saying that they shouldn't suck in their lane. Well... as a support main, I do have M6 on Vayne, Xayah and a few more adcs, I'm not terrible, but I'm pretty bad at farming, and I would still not dare go against an actual adc main in ranked games. Similarly, there are many tricks that an average adc main could not do as support, like land good Qs (you have to think one step ahead), shield at the right moment, and for the love of god, warding, it's a foreign word for adcs. So, yes, it's entirely possible that they suck in each other's roles.

^
Support mains are generally exempt from autofill.  Every support game gives you one queue of no autofill up to a cap.

I'm a support main a lot of times, literally i have never been autofilled when queuing with either pick being support. I don't understand how a support main could get autofilled when you are literally autofill protected every game you put in as support. More than likely the support main quit support and queued as something else, which is something many support mains, including myself do after struggling to carry bad adcs or teams in general. Your adc main did get autofilled, but i can't see how your supp main could have been autofilled. I'm sorry that worked out that way, maybe I'm wrong, but a supp getting autofilled is pretty weird if that happened tbh

im a support main (secondary role adc), i cant climb from a mixture of autofill to jng or top, and afk's. i have never heard of a support main trying to queue for another role because of struggling to carry, since supports can impact more lanes than just adc, its pretty easy to snowball. support getting autofilled has been happening since autofill protection for supports came into play, its just a flashy "fuck you" from riot who is going to fill you anyway

It's never happened to me unless i change my roles. I only started getting autofilled after i stopped supporting and the same can be said of the 10 or so friends i have that used to be supp mains and switched to carry roles. The thresh one trick switched to playing top, the lulu player switched to mid, etc. I stopped supporting due to afks bad adcs, etc. For a while i switched to adc, but sharing a lane with another and having them always let you down is frustrating and that is what all my other previously support friends have felt too and why they switched. You may nnot have heard of it but it does happen a lot.

I'm willing to give the benefit of the doubt and say that autofill for support does exist, but you can't sit there and act like all these ppl that get frustrated not being able to do anything with bad teams didn't stop playing support just because you never heard of it.

i am talking from my personal experience. i dont change my roles because why would i? that would be trying to lose the game because i dont play those roles to the same level as my main roles. i am saying i have never seen a support in soloq that wants to play another role, nor do i know any, i understand some people stop playing support because teammates are trash however that is not my experience and this board is the first ive heard about it in 4 years

Autofill is a shitty, awful system. It is terrible and flawed on practically all levels. 

I don't know why there is absolutely no accountability on any of Riot's teams. No matter how absolutely gigantic of a blunder any of them make, no matter how many times they fail catastrophically and do things that outrage their playerbase or simply make the game worse on all fronts (see: CertainlyT designing overloaded champions ever. single. time. Or who remembers POSITIONAL RANKS) none of them are ever held accountable. They are just allowed to continue making mistakes over and over and over again at all of our expenses.

Often times there are games where ill queue mid/top and my friend top/jg then i’ll get auto filled jg and him mid. It makes no sense why this would happen but it does, and far more often than it should.

When you get autofilled, the system doesn't care about what your secondary is, it just shoves you into whatever the team needs.

I think it's always been like that. 

Some time ago they changed the primary/secondary ratio because some people didn't want to get their secondary choice so often. Probably autofill wasn't working correctly before then, but now it still isn't and the autofill is therefore happening more often because of the primary/secondary change to make a mess of a system.

It's that or people are pathological liars and Riot should probably put in working indicators to prove if what people are claiming about autofill is correct but they probably aren't going to do that because easily exposing flaws in their matchmaking isn't something they want to enable or they would have done that a long time ago.

I queue supp/adc. Not because I'm a "dumb ass troll" but because I can play ADC better than players that are filled from other lanes that go in thinking "ADC is easy, you just shove the lane and right click" but then die to ganks/lose trades hard/play super safe and lose cs/have 0 lane presence/position like a moron, blow flash for nothing and die for free

My thinking is: If a support main gets support, I'm happy. I can play ADC decently, and so we have a decent bot lane. If either is autofilled and has no idea what they're doing it's very tough to do well

I main ADC and I'm a good support cause I watched what my good supports do. Also have quite a few buddies who play support are duh bomb. Shit, I got an S on leona first time i played her from watching these guys help me get double after double. GLORIOUS.
I go Supp/Mid, because I mostly play skillshot cc Supports (Lux, Leona, Morg and Thresh, in that order), and it turns out that translates well to Artillery Mages
You need to know how to play adc in order to be a good support.

Really, really, no you don't.

I don't know how to play adc worth shit, I full well know how to protect and adc, ward and trap people for my team.

@Invexus, there's more to support than just being a lane partner. Maybe you know this, but I've noticed the average support player doesn't. 

@Terozu, if you're really performing well then it's either being helped by a good lane partner, or you're overestimating your performance, or you would be a fine ADC. Nothing you are claiming makes any sense. You could learn other slots by watching replays as an example, but if you're doing that to up your support game then it's going to mean you'll know what to do when playing other slots. Will you be able to perform? Maybe not, but that doesn't mean you won't know what you're supposed to do.

maybe they didn't call their usual roles lol
or autofill is dumb
I've had a lot of games where my friend gets filled to my primary role and I get autofilled even though he queues as fill secondary. It's pretty stupid.

This is shear laziness in coding, plain and simple. Whilst it would be the work a few hours to include an additional few lines in Lobby to check what the people in it had ACTUALLY selected, anyone with even 2 brain cells to rub together should see that it's worth doing.

> [{quoted}](name=iPrawn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MLLzgAuv,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-06-30T12:58:47.612+0000)

> 
> You look up the players on your team, but it's too late to say anything because either the adc or the support already made their pick. If you had seen it sooner, or if they had looked themselves up, it might have been easy to get them to swap roles with each other.
> 
> Can Riot please look into this? Give the matchmaker one single brain cell? You would be surprised how often this happens. This is such a depressing way to lose a game. I mean, I don't mind losing, but I hate it when I have a loss that seems to be entirely due to a poorly coded matchmaker.
> 
> By the way, the entire enemey team had no autofills. Our team also had no autofills, except that our ADC was on support, and our support was our ADC. Our bot lane played poorly and lost their lane, and that was the entire reason we lost the game. And to think that we had a good ADC, and we had a good support! But they weren't on their damn roles! We had all we needed to win that game! If only the match maker had a brain.


If an ADC player can't play support, or a Support player can't play ADC, then they aren't a very good bot lane player :3

Of all people to autofill the role, they should know best what their partner needs/expects.
I agree to an extent. A lotta folks have no interest in playing support, so they only watch their supports for the play about to be made.
You're right, but he's probably talking about a game of low average skill where players are being 'bullied' by Riot into learning more than just one team slot.
